intro: Cousinia singularis, commonly known as the narrowleaf cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in the summer months. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Cousinia singularis is often found in alpine meadows and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance.
